{"step_by_step_thinking": "Port wine stains are a type of vascular malformation, not a type of nevus, hemangioma, or melanoma. According to Document [4], a port-wine stain (nevus flammeus) is a discoloration of the human skin caused by a vascular anomaly (a capillary malformation in the skin). Therefore, the correct answer is Nevus.", "answer_choice": "A"}
